detaileddescription.para: This API will return the top 1000 tags used by an author sorted by most frequently used

memberdef.argsstring: (account_name_type start_author, std::string start_permlink, uint32_t limit) const
memberdef.name: get_replies_by_last_update

detaileddescription.para: For each of these filters: Get root content... Get any content... Get root content in category.. Get any content in category...
Return discussions Total Discussion Pending Payout Last Discussion Update (or reply)... think Top Discussions by Total Payout

Return content (comments) Pending Payout Amount Pending Payout Time Creation Date Return the active discussions with the highest cumulative pending payouts without respect to category, total pending payout means the pending payout of all children as well.
This method can be used to fetch replies to an account.
The first call should be (account_to_retrieve replies, "", limit) Subsequent calls should be (last_author, last_permlink, limit)

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string author, std::string start_permlink, time_point_sec before_date, uint32_t limit) const
memberdef.name: get_discussions_by_author_before_date

detaileddescription.para: This method is used to fetch all posts/comments by start_author that occur after before_date and start_permlink with up to limit being returned.
If start_permlink is empty then only before_date will be considered. If both are specified the eariler to the two metrics will be used. This should allow easy pagination.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string account, uint64_t from, uint32_t limit) const
memberdef.name: get_account_history

detaileddescription.para: Account operations have sequence numbers from 0 to N where N is the most recent operation. This method returns operations in the range [from-limit, from]

parameterdescription.para: - the absolute sequence number, -1 means most recent, limit is the number of operations before from.
- the maximum number of items that can be queried (0 to 1000], must be less than from

memberdef.argsstring: (const discussion_query &query, const std::string &tag, comment_id_type parent, const Index &tidx, StartItr tidx_itr, const std::function< bool(const comment_api_obj &)> &filter=&database_api::filter_default, const std::function< bool(const comment_api_obj &)> &exit=&database_api::exit_default, const std::function< bool(const tags::tag_object &)> &tag_exit=&database_api::tag_exit_default) const
memberdef.name: get_discussions

detaileddescription.para: This call assumes root already stored as part of state, it will modify root.replies to contain links to the reply posts and then add the reply discussions to the state. This method also fetches any accounts referenced by authors.
This unsubscribes from all subscribed markets and objects.
This API is a short-cut for returning all of the state required for a particular URL with a single query.

parameterdescription.para: Height of the block whose header should be returned

simplesect.para: header of the referenced block, or null if no matching block was found

parameterdescription.para: Height of the block to be returned

simplesect.para: the referenced block, or null if no matching block was found

briefdescription.para: Get sequence of operations included/generated within a particular block.

parameterdescription.para: Height of the block whose generated virtual operations should be returned
Whether to only include virtual operations in returned results (default: true)

simplesect.para: sequence of operations included/generated within the block

briefdescription.para: Return a JSON description of object representations.

simplesect.para: JSON description of object representations in a string
all accounts that referr to the key or account id in their owner or active authorities.

briefdescription.para: Get a list of accounts by name.

detaileddescription.para:
account_names
Names of the accounts to retrieve
The accounts holding the provided names This function has semantics identical to get_objects

briefdescription.para: Get names and IDs for registered accounts.

parameterdescription.para: Lower bound of the first name to return
Maximum number of results to return must not exceed 1000

simplesect.para: Map of account names to corresponding IDs

briefdescription.para: Get the total number of accounts registered with the blockchain.
Get a list of witnesses by ID.

detaileddescription.para:
witness_ids
IDs of the witnesses to retrieve
The witnesses corresponding to the provided IDs This function has semantics identical to get_objects

briefdescription.para: Get the witness owned by a given account.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the account whose witness should be retrieved

simplesect.para: The witness object, or null if the account does not have a witness

detaileddescription.para: This method is used to fetch witnesses with pagination.

simplesect.para: an array of count witnesses sorted by total votes after witness from with at most `limit' results.

briefdescription.para: Get names and IDs for registered witnesses.

parameterdescription.para: Lower bound of the first name to return
Maximum number of results to return must not exceed 1000

simplesect.para: Map of witness names to corresponding IDs

briefdescription.para: Get the total number of witnesses registered with the blockchain.

detaileddescription.para:
Gets the current order book for STEEM:SBD market
limit
Maximum number of orders for each side of the spread to return Must not exceed 1000

Gets the current liquidity reward queue.
start_account
The account to start the list from, or "" to get the head of the queue
limit
Maxmimum number of accounts to return Must not exceed 1000

briefdescription.para: Get a hexdump of the serialized binary form of a transaction.

detaileddescription.para: This API will take a partially signed transaction and a std::set of public keys that the owner has the ability to sign for and return the minimal substd::set of public keys that should add signatures to the transaction.

This method will return the std::set of all public keys that could possibly sign for a given transaction. This call can be used by wallets to filter their std::set of public keys to just the relevant substd::set prior to calling get_required_signatures to get the minimum substd::set.

simplesect.para: true of the trx has all of the required signatures, otherwise throws an exception

detaileddescription.para: if permlink is "" then it will return all votes for author

briefdescription.para: The database_api class implements the RPC API for the chain database.

detaileddescription.para: This API exposes accessors on the database which query state tracked by a blockchain validating node. This API is read-only; all modifications to the database must be performed via transactions. Transactions are broadcast via the network_broadcast_api.
